topic.title: Modifying Dynamic Messages by Inserting a Field of Different Form

othermeta.name: title
othermeta.content: Modifying Dynamic Messages of Different Form

othermeta.name: shortdesc
othermeta.content: Explains how to modify dynamic error messages for different forms using the message editor and Blockly integrations.

othermeta.name: usecase
othermeta.content: edit dynamic error messages and manage placeholder variables for different forms

body.context: You can modify dynamic messages by inserting a field of different form through UI using Insert Other Form Field option. You can also modify the variables in the dynamic messages using Google Blockly (Blockly).

li.p: In the module menu, click Administration.
In the navigation pane, expand the Configuration Toolkit folder, and then click Error Message Configurator.
The ERROR MESSAGE CONFIGURATOR list page is displayed.
In the ERROR MESSAGE CONFIGURATOR list page, select the appropriate error message, and then click Edit.
The ERROR MESSAGE CONFIGURATOR page is displayed.
Based on the error message in the Value field, rewrite the error message in the New Error Message field.
Place the cursor where the dynamic variable must be inserted in the New Error Message field.
A pop-up is displayed where you can search and retrieve the fields from other modules or forms.
To search and retrieve the appropriate field information from other modules or forms, perform the following steps:

ol.li:
Click Read Data.The Read Data feature retrieves the appropriate information from other modules or forms using a reference field that is common between the source and the destination form.
The following screen is displayed on the right pane of the screen.

To search the appropriate information from the destination form, in the SELECT field, define the appropriate values in the Select Module, Select Form, and Select Field.The SELECT field searches for the defined values in the Select Field from the Select Form that belongs to the Select Module entities.

To define the relationship between the destination form and the source form, in the WHERE field, define the appropriate values in the Select Module, Select Form, and Select Field.
The WHERE field acts as the reference identifier between the source and the destination form.
The WHERE field retrieves the defined values from the Select Field of the Select Form that belongs to the Select Module entities.

To define the identifier of the record, click Filters, and then use the appropriate filters as applicable: Once added, you can remove the filter by dragging and dropping it to in the center right corner of the screen.
Get Value of: To retrieve a list of identifiers from the source form, perform the following steps:
Drag and drop the Get Value of filter in the double quoted empty field.The Get Value of filter defines which identifier or reference field should be validated from the source form to retrieve a field from the destination form.
Place the cursor in the empty field adjacent to the Get Value of filter.
The Search Fields bar is displayed.
To add fields to the Get Value of filter, search the field name in the Search Fields bar, and select the appropriate field when it is displayed.
Resolve Value of: To retrieve the common attributes between the source and the destination form, perform the following steps:
Drag and drop the Resolve Value of filter in the double quoted empty field. The Resolve Value of filter consists of Parent Module Id, Module ID, Project details, and user details that are used as identifiers.
Click the Select Resolver field adjacent to the Resolve Value of filter.
From the Select Resolver drop-down list, select the appropriate attributes.

li.p:
The selected variables are added to the appropriate place in the New Error Message field.
Alternatively, you can click Restore to modify the values.
The modified error message is displayed in the ERROR MESSAGE CONFIGURATOR list page for the respective record.
